page.title: 01Area South of Runswick Bay
page.content: A relatively undeveloped block used primarily for farming and tourism. In the National Park & including Heritage Coast it is valued for its scenery and unspoilt appearance. In the E then on 50-200ft high cliffs & steep grassy slopes (old quarries) leading to a rocky shore and in north west is a wide sandy beech of Runswick Bay overlooked by the old fishibg village beyond. Gently undulating hills of farms and basin of the bay some rough ground and a heavily wooded valley make the coastal area in particular popular with tourists who use the beech, and walk the Cleveland way and other footpaths, sailing is popular here. Populated by many small farms & the small villages of Goldsborough & Kettleness. Amenities are few but some tourist facilities are provided at nearby Runswick Bay
